original:
In biology, a biological life cycle, often referred to simply as a life cycle when the context is clear, describes the series of stages an organism undergoes from its inception as a zygote, typically within an egg, to its maturation as an adult capable of reproduction. This cycle culminates in the production of offspring, which are also zygotes, thereby initiating a repetitive process.

The concept of a life cycle is closely related to
